thread.title: GHANASoccernet.com's Team of the Week: Ghanaian players abroad
thread.title_full: GHANASoccernet.com's Team of the Week: Ghanaian players abroad

title: GHANASoccernet.com's Team of the Week: Ghanaian players abroad
text:
Sports News | 5 October 2015 08:25 CET GHANASoccernet.com's Team of the Week: Ghanaian players abroad - www.ghanasoccernet.com 
The system for the team of the week is 4:3:3Ghana U20 goalie, Lawrence Ati Zigi jumped above Razak Braimah and Kwarasey to pick the gloves with an impressive performance for Liefering in Austria. 
Caen right back Dennis Appiah continued his impressive run as they won against Saint Etienne. 
SWAG player of the year, Harrison Afful assisted Columbus crew to register their first goal against New York Red Bulls. 
Bussaspor center back John Boye scored his second goal of the season as they drew 2-2 with Mersin. 
Daniel Amartey was instrumental in central defense for Copenhagen in their 1-0 win over Viborg. 
The midfield is a trio of Anthony Annan in defensive role with Jeffery Sclupp who scored for Leicester City on the left and Ernest Asante who scored his 9th goal of the season on the right. 
Andre Ayew fetched his 4th goal of the season for Swansea City to partner Majeed Waris and David Accam. Waris scored for Lorient while Accam also scored for Chicago Fire in the U.S. A. 
Solomon Asante's devastating form saw TP Mazembe cruising to the finals of the CAF Champions League. He made the bench with Razak Braimah of Cordoba and Abdul Osman of Partick Thistle. 
Gent's left back, Nana Aasre, Ernest Asante of Stabaek, Dominic Oduro of Montreal Impact, David Atanga of Liefering and Ebenezer Ofori of AIK also made the bench. 
For more Ghana football news visit www.ghanasoccernet.com
